instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not connect, no consumption at source.
threads.message: This mac arrived dead, watch some videos on the internet and I verified that the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and charge controller, I made the reflow on it and it worked again, but after some months the client came back with the same defect, I made the IC replacement, but it didn't work. I would like to know if it only works with new IC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not connect, no consumption at source.
threads.message:
Where do you think to get "NEW" chip???
It doesn't exist...

You probably have a dead CPU now, like in all these f***g boards.
